reviews.review_text: Oh my god, what a game. I'm into round 7 of over 200 in the big campaign and spend about 2 hours in each round just to make everything right and loving every minut of it.  If you love statistics that do matter to the game, not just fancy charts and numbers to fool stategylovers to buy the game but tons of real numbers that relates to the actual gameplay, this is a game for you. And there is tons af numbers...  You do need to read the manual and have some try and error-games behind you to really enjoy but its worth it.

Steam doesn't reflect play time for this game - I only actually installed it on steam to write this. Lots of positive reviews. I'll put in the negative one because this game has one huge flaw. It's a strategic level game with copious detail to try and allow for historically plausible outcomes from player decisions. Only railway lines have infinite supply. Yes, you can feed the entire German army and airforce from just one (two track) railway line. Or the Red Army if Soviets are your thing. Since the game's release this has caused endless attempts to balance and re-balance the game.   It's a huge flaw. War in the West is supposed to have learned from this, so you may want to investigate that. War in the Pacific:Admiral's Edition scratches itches even the most obsessive micromanager didn't know he had. But War in the East, for all the appearance of detail and immensity, is a game which is horribly holed below the water line by the infinite supply on a railway line.  The one Matrix game I wish I could have refunded if I'd know the issue was never going to be fixed.

I am fan of historical ww2 simulation games and I bellieve this is the first time I really have in my hands a true ww2 simulator.  The deph is astonishing, the historical acuracy of the units are mind blowing. It's like having the whole ww2 encyclopedia with all the units in your hands and I bet that the reasearch behind this was very long. Everything is on big scale, huge scenarios with amazing care for detail where each soldier, tank, weapon, arty support..have it's range, firepower and strenght calculated among with other factor like terrain, fatigue, weather and commander.  Once you get hand's on this game you will fully understand the price of the game, the developers have created a game that other big developers even dream about.  If you look for 100% realism, and want to unleash your historical 4.000 different troops on the battle, you must have this tittle in your list. It may take days to capture one small city or region weeks for a scenario, this is epic!  Waiting for more updates from this great team.

This certainly is one of the best hardcore strategy games - not easy to learn and truly hard to master, but with unrivaled depth, historical accuracy, replayability value and a decent AI when you have no human opponent at hand.   I can honestly recommend it.
Theres something addicting about sending millions of men to their deaths.
This is a game I've grown to love really fast! With the sale that is happening until February 12th, 2016, I couldn't resist a 50% off ! Well worth it !

Had to express my appreciation for the game, been playing GG made games since the 80s and then not played for the last 15 years ,have come back with a vengeance the next 12 months are fully booked now, hours and hours of pleasure truely a real test of everything i know and still have to learn about the Eastern front campaigns. Riga week 1 ?. NP lol .All the best to you all for the New year.
This is a very awesome game. The historical aspect is very accurate and its alot better than Heasrt Of Iron. But the game is a very big learning curve. But my belief its worth the buy.

The classic game of the Soviet-German conflict. Essential to start with the scenarios to become used to how the game plays but the core is the grand campaign game. The AI will give you a good challenge but worth trying PBEM for the ultimate test.
